result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Donald S Watts not in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Donald S Watts.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 1:47 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for bail forfeiture. Record by Atty. Ryan who has had no contact with the defendant. Based upon non-appearances, Court enters judgment as to bail forfeiture.
Notice of Bail Bond Forfeiture and Hearing. Bond set 7-18-2022.

Defendant Donald S Watts not in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Donald S Watts.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant to issue, bond forfeited. Attorney lost contact with client. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donald Watts not present. Attorney Josh Ryan appears. ADA Vivien TenHaken appears for the State of Wisconsin. Unknown if Deft had notice of today's hearing. Court will set out for State to make charging decision & Atty Ryan to reach out to Deft to notify him of next court date.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Donald S Watts not in court. Vivien TenHaken for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Josh Ryan for defendant. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH W1374 W POST RD, GENOA CITY, WI. NO CONTACT WITH P.J.M. dob 7-16-1992 or A.D.S. dob 7-21-1994 OR THEIR RESIDENCES. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Donald S Watts in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hagerman appeared for defendant. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
